attributes.action: Do not implement mini exams instead of summer exams for A-Levels. AS and GCSEs.
attributes.additional_details: Any form of examination in the summer would put a ridiculous amount of stress on students who have missed over 6 months of education, and went through 3 national lockdowns. There is plenty of time to sort out a way of giving predicted grades which are fair and reasonable. So many pupils have had gone through several problems of at-home learning, and ‘mini-exams’ would not be fair in anyway. Sitting ‘mini-exams’ is no different from sitting normal exams in the summer and would not solve anything.
attributes.background: Instead of implementing mini exams that would be taken in the summer like normal exams, students should receive either their teacher predicted grades or fairly given Center Assessed Grades.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Cancel GCSE and A-levels in 2021 replace with Course Work and Teacher Assessment: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/564696

Base 2021 GCSE and A-Level Grades on Teacher Considerations and Mock Grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553307

Give students the option to take exams or receive assessed grades for 2020/21: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/559964

The Department for Education and Ofqual are consulting on the approach to awarding GCSE, AS and A level grades in 2021 following the cancellation of exams. You can find out more about this consultation here: https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/consultation-on-how-gcse-as-and-a-level-grades-should-be-awarded-in-summer-2021
